intro: Tragia winkleri, commonly known as the Winkler's tragia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy, succulent leaves. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on xerophytic plant adaptations.
